author: nivracer
title: new cars set
review: This is my 1st cars set I put is together in 10 minutes. Finn McMissile. He floats well. The rims are new and look better. He has 1 wepon the hook thing he shoots to pull him up. Professor Z.  He has a magnafing glass that works! Original lego rims. Not best colors.  the boat. He has 2 rockest to try to kill Finn McMissile. 4 stickers! Thats it for my reiveiw. Cars don't have stickers. Boat & cones dont float correctly.

author: e01
title: Has a good amount of cars, but you can't play much with it.
review: This set is twenty dollars, which is a fair price for three cars and a giant boat. However, even with the cars- the boat is not very easy to play with. For example, the Professor Z can barely fit on the back part of the boat (as seen in the picture). The boat often tips over while playing with it, or even just on a flat surface. The Finn McMissile car is a good reason to get this- seeing that it is probably the only set to get it that is under, say $40. Only but this set if it's on sale of 20% or more, I say.

author: CharlieTheFunEngine
title: TinyTurbosCityAndToyStory Reviews Episode 28: Escape At Sea
review:
Escape At Sea is the only set in which you can get Finn McMissile in his submarine form, which will go very nicely with his hydrofoil form which will be released next year. Professor Z is a cool model, despite being a little off colour-wise and missing his trademark comb-over. The boat, Tony Trihull, is just big enough for Professor Z to ride on and is an exclusive.

Building Experience:

The vehicles are fun to build, Professor Z more than Submarine Finn McMissile.

Parts:

Lots of parts that are new to my collection, but it would have been nice if the parts to return Finn McMissile to his regular form had been included. Regular Finn McMissile does not come cheap in Australia. Check us out under the "Buy" tab here.

Playability:

Not as good as it could be. As Tony Trihull does not float, is would have been nice if he had little rollers underneath for dry play.

Value for Money:

Slightly expensive. AUD$29 is not quite good enough, maybe AUD$23 but not AUD$29.

Overall:

Adequate set for display and basic play.
